verbs.description: [ARGM-TMP: as reform gains traction] [ARG0: chicago police union] [V: pushes] [ARG2: back] [ARG1: comprehensive police reform] is gaining significant traction in chicago after decades of damaging scandals as politicians and activists line up behind an overhaul that soon could have the force of a federal judge behind it but even as fallout from the fatal laquan mcdonald shooting has turned the political tide one local group continues to strongly push back attorney eddie murphy christy lopez vice president joel d’alba first vice president fraternal order of police emanuel waffled tribune martin preib emanuel administration jon burge police u s department of justice justice department mcdonald south side irish parade illinois georgetown university contesting law department jennifer smith richards police department president donald trump jason van dyke prosecutor chicago police department murder slate dhinkel chicagotribue com michael garza rahm emanuel u s 7th circuit court of appeals mayor rahm emanuel donald trump perjury executive director city hall maria hernandez chicago fraternal order of police chicago john j lisa madigan englewood patrick murray judge robert dow jr paul butler professor official laquan mcdonald city council finance committee kevin graham bill mccaffrey south side fop officer dean angelo sr jim pasco van dyke president illinois labor relations board secretary
